divide.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts
divide.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Scientists traditionally divide the oceans into zones.
The book is divided into six sections.
Here, the river divides into three channels.
divide.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to keep two areas separate from each other
divide.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The Wall used to divide East and West Berlin.
Only a thin curtain divided her cabin from his.
divide.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to separate something into parts and share them between people
divide.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
divide.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if you divide your time, energy etc between different activities or places, you spend part of your time doing each activity or in each place
divide.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: She divides her time between New York and Paris.
divide.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to calculate how many times one number contains a smaller number
divide.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: If you divide 21 by 3, you get 7.
divide.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to be contained exactly in a number one or more times
divide.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to make people disagree so that they form groups with different opinions
divide.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: The issue of cloning has sharply divided voters.
divide.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a strong difference between the beliefs or way of life of groups of people, that may make them hate each other
divide.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The North/South divide is characteristic of Britain.
people on both sides of the political divide
divide.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a line of high ground between two river systems
